title: Liste der IdPs
json:content:
{"main": {"ds-label": "Content", "ds-type": "wysiwyg", "ds-value": "

{% extends 'WebsiteLayout' %}

{% block content %}


Liste der Identit\u00e4tsanbieter (IdPs)

Die Bundesverwaltung nutzt eigene Identit\u00e4tsprovider (Definition) und solche von Drittanbietern.

(Intern: Das eIAM-IdP-Konzept finden Sie unter www.eiam.admin.ch/idp)

Nutzungsbedingungen

In vielen F\u00e4llen k\u00f6nnen Endnutzerinnen und Endnutzer w\u00e4hlen, welchen Identit\u00e4tsanbieter sie im Verkehr mit der Bundesverwaltung nutzen m\u00f6chten. Die Nutzung von Diensten Dritter erfolgt auf eigenes Risiko der Nutzerinnen und Nutzer. Insbesondere hat die Bundesverwaltung keinen Einfluss auf die Funktionsf\u00e4higkeit und Verf\u00fcgbarkeit.

Beziehung der Zielanwendungen zu den IdPs

Die Zielanwendungen der Bundesverwaltung haben keinen direkten Kontakt zu den IdPs, sondern sind an eIAM angebunden. Folglich k\u00f6nnen die IdPs nicht feststellen, f\u00fcr welche Zielanwendung eine Authentifizierung stattfindet. Aus Sicht der IdPs ist die Bundesverwaltung eine einzige vertrauende Partei im Sinne einer einzigen Anbindung an den jeweiligen IdP.

IdP-Gruppe: \u00abBYOI\u00bb (AGOV und andere)

Gedacht f\u00fcr alle nat\u00fcrlichen Personen, die in eigenem Namen oder im Auftrag einer juristischen Person handeln (z.B. Vertreter der Industrie), nicht jedoch f\u00fcr HR-unregistrierte Mitarbeitende der Bundesverwaltung (und deren Tochtergesellschaften). IdPs aus dieser Gruppe k\u00f6nnen nicht einzeln bestellt werden, es wird immer nur die gesamte Gruppe zur Verf\u00fcgung gestellt.

BYOI steht f\u00fcr Bring Your Own Identity und umfasst Login-Methoden wie AGOV, CH-LOGIN, EDA-LOGIN, edu-ID und kantonale Logins.

{% include 'IDPList' %}

{% endblock %}

"}}

title: List of IDPs
json:content:
{"main": {"ds-label": "Content", "ds-type": "wysiwyg", "ds-value": "

{% extends 'WebsiteLayout' %}

{% block content %}


List of identity providers (IdPs)

The Federal Administration uses its own identity providers (definition) and those of third parties.

(Internal: The eIAM-IdP concept can be found at www.eiam.admin.ch/idp)

Terms of use

In many cases, end users can choose which identity provider they wish to use in dealings with the Federal Administration. The use of third-party services is at the user's own risk. In particular, the Federal Administration has no influence on proper functioning or availability.

Relationship of the target applications to the IdPs

The target applications of the federal administration have no direct contact with the IdPs, but are connected to eIAM. Consequently, IdPs cannot determine for which target application an authentication is taking place. From the IdP's point of view, the federal administration is a single relying party in the sense of a single connection to the respective IdP.

IdP Group: \u00abBYOI\u00bb (AGOV and others)

Intended for all natural persons acting on their own behalf or on behalf of a legal entity (e.g. representatives of industry), but not for HR-unregistered employees of the Federal Administration (and affiliates). IdPs from this group cannot be ordered individually, only the entire group is always made available.

BYOI stands for Bring Your Own Identity and includes login methods such as AGOV, CH-LOGIN, EDA-LOGIN, edu-ID and cantonal logins.

{% include 'IDPList' %}

{% endblock %}

"}}

title: Start page
json:content:
{"main": {"ds-label": "Content", "ds-type": "wysiwyg", "ds-value": "

{% extends 'WebsiteLayout' %}

{% block content %}

eIAM

eIAM is the Federal Administration's central access and permissions system for web applications and native mobile apps*

eIAM instructional video
00:02
eIAM, definition
What is eIAM?
00:39
Market model, obligation to use
Positioning of eIAM in the ecosystem
01:42
Connectivity (SAML, OIDC etc.)
Security integrations and more


Put simply, eIAM is the Confederation's central login infrastructure; the aim is to avoid having to create a separate login procedure for each application.

This centralisation saves money and allows all applications to be used with the same login data.

It doesn't matter how the target application is used, or where; eIAM can run applications all over the world.

CH-LOGIN FAQ & Help\u2192

CH-LOGIN is the eIAM login for citizens and business representatives.

Technical information for internal and external IT specialists\u2192

Description of services, glossary, connecting applications to eIAM.

Internal users: Information for application officers and integration managers\u2192

FCh DTI sounding board, discussion forum, requirements management, P035 status, roadmap, usage obligation, FOITT tariff, My eIAM dossier: procurement, integration.

{% endblock %}

{% block right %}

{% include 'HomeRightSidebar' %}

{% endblock %}

"}}

title: Test-Startseite
json:content:
{"main": {"ds-label": "Inhalt", "ds-type": "wysiwyg", "ds-value": "

{% extends 'WebsiteLayout' %}

{% block content %}

eIAM

eIAM ist das zentrale Zugriffs- und Berechtigungssystem der Bundesverwaltung f\u00fcr Webanwendungen und native Mobile Apps*

eIAM instructional video
00:02
eIAM, Definition
Was ist eIAM?
00:39
Marktmodell, Nutzungspflicht
Positionierung von eIAM im \u00d6kosystem
01:42
Konnektivit\u00e4t (SAML, OIDC usw.)
Sicherheitsintegrationen und mehr


Vereinfacht ausgedr\u00fcckt ist eIAM die zentrale Login-Infrastruktur des Bundes. Ziel ist es, die Erstellung eines separaten Login-Verfahrens f\u00fcr jede Anwendung zu vermeiden.

Diese Zentralisierung spart Kosten und erm\u00f6glicht die Nutzung aller Anwendungen mit denselben Login-Daten.

Unabh\u00e4ngig davon, wie und wo die Zielanwendung genutzt wird, kann eIAM Anwendungen weltweit betreiben.

CH-LOGIN FAQ & Hilfe\u2192

CH-LOGIN ist das eIAM-Login f\u00fcr B\u00fcrger und Wirtschaftsvertreter.

Technische Informationen f\u00fcr interne und externe IT-Spezialisten \u2192

Leistungsbeschreibung, Glossar, Anbindung von Anwendungen an eIAM.

Interne Nutzer: Informationen f\u00fcr Bewerbungsbeauftragte und Integrationsmanager \u2192

FCh DTI sounding Board, Diskussionsforum, Anforderungsmanagement, P035-Status, Roadmap, Nutzungspflicht, BIT-Tarif, Mein eIAM-Dossier: Beschaffung, Integration.

{% endblock %}

{% block right %}

{% include 'HomeRightSidebar' %}

{% endblock %}

title: Format Examples
json:content:
{"main": {"ds-label": "Content", "ds-type": "wysiwyg", "ds-value": "

{% extends 'WebsiteLayout' %}

{% block content %}

Explore What You Can Create with your CMS

Welcome to the Format Examples page \u2014 a quick showcase of what\u2019s possible inside the content editor.
Whether you\u2019re creating an internal service description, an announcement, or a detailed technical article, this page helps you see how your text, images, and media will appear once published.

Your CMS is designed for clarity and flexibility \u2014 empowering you to format your content exactly the way you want, without needing to touch code.
Below, you\u2019ll find examples of text styles, layouts, and embedded media you can use to build rich, accessible, and visually engaging pages.

Text Formatting

You can emphasize your message with simple inline styles:

  • Bold \u2013 highlight key terms or names

  • Italic \u2013 add a softer tone or emphasize quotations

  • Underline \u2013 draw attention to important details

  • Strikethrough \u2013 mark outdated or corrected text

  • Highlight \u2013 make key phrases stand out

  • <code> \u2013 display technical snippets or commands

Headings and Structure

Organize your content using heading levels \u2014 ideal for readability and SEO:

  • Heading 1 \u2013 Main section title

  • Heading 2 \u2013 Subsection

  • Heading 3 & 4 \u2013 Smaller nested sections

Good structure helps your readers scan quickly and keeps your content consistent across the site.

Quotes and Paragraphs

\u201cLorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry.\u201d

Use quote blocks to emphasize insights, references, or testimonials.
Standard paragraphs flow naturally and adapt to different devices and screen sizes.

Lines and Lists

Add horizontal lines to separate sections and improve readability.

Bulleted lists are perfect for unordered points:

  • First item

  • Second item

  • Third item

Numbered lists keep step-by-step instructions organized:

  1. First step

  2. Second step

  3. Third step

You can also include subscript and superscript text when needed \u2014 for example, H\u2082O or x\u00b2.

Links and Alignment

Insert links easily to reference other pages or external sources.
Example: Visit our homepage

You can also align your text as you prefer:

  • Left-aligned for standard reading

  • Center-aligned for titles or highlights

  • Right-aligned for signatures or callouts

  • Justified for a balanced, professional look

Images and Galleries

Images bring your content to life.
You can insert a single image with a caption or create a gallery to display multiple visuals.

Description about image


Gallery Example:

Caption 1
Caption 2
Caption 3

  • Multiple images with optional captions

  • Responsive layout that adapts to screen size

  • Lightbox viewing for fullscreen mode

Tables

Use tables to organize structured information such as comparisons, data, or contact details.

Column 1

Column 2

Column 3

Embedded Components

You can enrich your content with reusable HTML/CSS/JS components such as service descriptions, forms, or embedded applications.

Example \u2013 Simple JavaScript app

{% include 'SampleJSCounter' %}

Embedded Videos

Add videos directly from platforms like YouTube to create more dynamic pages.

Beautiful places Aerial Views

Summary

The Format Examples page shows just how flexible and powerful your CMS editor is.
With intuitive tools, responsive layouts, and support for structured content, authors can focus on communicating effectively \u2014 the system takes care of the rest.

{% endblock %}

{% block right %}

{% include 'HomeRightSidebar' %}

{% endblock %}

"}}
